definition: a place buzzing with activity (idiom)
(used in names)/(bound form) (literary) bright/prosperous/splendid/genial
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to push up one's sleeves/to reject or resist/to seize/to perturb/to steal
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: The road is lonely in its crown, for it is not loved.
sentences.chinese: 熙來攘往的街道最是寂寞，因爲它不被人所愛。

sentences.english: Now and again on both shores trains chuffed by amid shining smoke.
sentences.chinese: 兩岸的火車熙來攘往，冒着煙光。

sentences.english: Tourists were swarming all over the island.
sentences.chinese: 島上到處是旅遊者熙來攘往。

sentences.english: Seasons change but remain unchanged is the sizable crowd.
sentences.chinese: 春夏秋冬，四季更迭，不變的是熙來攘往的人羣。

sentences.english: They claimed to have many customers per day, but couldn’t tell us how much they sold in a month.
sentences.chinese: 該店聲稱每日顧客熙來攘往，但不能透露月營業額。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
top of streets, bottom of alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
stallkeeper/peddler
downtown
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
noisy
the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
crowded with visitors/packed with tourists
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
brightly lit
to hawk (one's wares)/to peddle
billboard
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
